doc.name: put content
doc.summary: Write the given (unicode) string to stdout, processing it for suitable output in an SGML content context.

description.overview: Use the put content command to write a string to stdout that contains HTML markup. This functions identically to 'put markup' except that '<', '>', '&' and '"' are encoded as named entities - <, >, & and ".

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: A string containing the HTML markup to output. If 'unicode' is not specified, then string is considered to be in the native text encoding for the platform. If unicode is specified, then string is considered to be in UTF-16.
